result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric Dewayne Lee was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Violate/Harassment Restraining Order, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.125(7).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: * The court orders defendant to pay all applicable costs, fees, assessments and surcharges as a condition of probation as imposed in counts 3 and 5 and failure to do so will result in entry of civil judgment.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Probation Review Hearing scheduled for February 12, 2016 at 01:15 pm. Defendant is remanded.

miscConds.notes: *Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, domestic violence surcharge as applicable, and all costs, assessments and surcharges as imposed in counts 1 and 7, and supervision fees as determined by Dept of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.

*No contact with firearms.
*48 USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.

*NO CONTACT with the victim, UNLESS requested by victim and then only with prior approval of agent or the court.
*NO NEW LAW VIOLATIONS.

*Attend and successfully complete Batterers Intervention and continued programming.
*Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.
*AODA and recommended treatment including random urine screens/Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

timeConds.notes: *STAYED pending a review on 2-12-2016 at 1:15pm in Branch 38.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Eric Dewayne Lee

records.addlTxt: JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Eric Dewayne Lee in court.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant Eric Dewayne Lee in court with attorney Mark Stuart Tishberg.  Defendant Eric Dewayne Lee in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by all parties to the court.
As to counts 1 and 7:   The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 6 months in the House of Correction, concurrent with one another, with credit for 91 days time served each count.    The court orders defendant to pay all applicable costs, fees, assessments and surcharges as a condition of probation as imposed in counts 3 and 5 and failure to do so will result in entry of civil judgment.
As to count 3:   The court sentenced the defendant to serve 90 days in the House of Correction,  with credit for 0 days time served. 
The court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on probation with the WI Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months, concurrent.
As to count 5:    The court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to count 3, with credit for 0 days time served. 
The court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on probation with the WI Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months, concurrent.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION as to both counts:
-Serve 25 days in the House of Correction STAYED pending a review on 2-12-2016 at 1:15pm in Branch 38.
-Attend and successfully complete Batterers Intervention and continued programming.
-AODA and recommended treatment including random urine screens/Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
-Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.
-NO CONTACT with the victim, UNLESS requested by victim and then only with prior approval of agent or the court.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-NO NEW LAW VIOLATIONS.
-Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, domestic violence surcharge as applicable, and all costs, assessments and surcharges as imposed in counts 1 and 7, and supervision fees as determined by Dept of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.
-48 USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.
RECEIVED & FILED:  Pretrial Incarceration Credit; Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.
Defendant is remanded.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for February 12, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
Surety returned Bail Forfeiture card after the 30 day window expired (date stamped 10-14-15) and bail has already been forfeited.

Defendant Eric Dewayne Lee in court with attorney Mark Tishberg.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Eric Dewayne Lee in custody.  Matter was set for trial today, however, parties have reached a resolution.
Count 7 is amended to OBSTRUCTING AN OFFICER, class A misdemeanor, 946.41(1)
AS to counts 1,3,5 and 7 as amended:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant  examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  
As to counts 2,4,6,8 court orders them dismissed and read in for sentencing.
Defendant is remanded pending sentencing on 10-22-2015.
Notice returned undeliverable.  sb
Defendant's Bail Forfeiture Notice returned undeliverable.
Notice of bail forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant; Original in file. ($2,500) ad
Court ordered original cash bail forfeited.

Defendant Eric Dewayne Lee in court with attorney Mark Stuart Tishberg.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Discussions of Justice Point Violation Reports placed on the record. Bail motion by the state argued and granted by the Court.  Bail $2,500 cash bail with TOT to Justice Point. Case remains set for Jury trial on 10/12/2015 at 8:15am.
Received and Filed, Justice Point Report.

Received and Filed, TWO Justice Point VIOLATION Reports.

Amended Information filed by the state adding count 8, STALKING, Domestic Abuse Assessments, a Class I felony, 940.32(2), 939.50(3)(i), 973.055(1).
Copy of amended information given to defense, who waived its reading and entered a plea of not guilty as to count 8.

Defendant Eric Dewayne Lee in court with attorney Mark Stuart Tishberg.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense motion to modify conditions of bail and for defendant to attend funeral heard by the court.  The state objects to any modifications, but has no objection to attending funeral.
The court will allow the defendant from 9:30am to 1:30pm on August 5, 2015 to attend the funeral of his brother-in-law at Northwest Funeral Home upon verification by Justicepoint.
The court will allow 2 hours for rent assistance to be completed once ok'd by Justicepoint.
The court will allow 2 hours 1 time weekly for job search and upon notice to the court and verification by Justicepoint the court will allow release for work.
Motion to Modify Conditions of Bail filed by defense.

Defaulting Witness, Christina A., appears in court pro-se.  Sarra Kiaie appeared for Nicolas Heitman for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defaulting Witness was subpoenaed to appear today's date for a Jury Trial in Branch 4 at 8:30 am and failed to appear. Christina A., was served a subpoena and agrees to return on the adjourned Jury Trial date of 10-12-2015 at 8:15 am, in Branch 38.  Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse.   mld

Defendant Eric Dewayne Lee in court with attorney Sergio Magana.  Defendant Eric Dewayne Lee in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Milwaukee Police Officer Jay Ehlers and Milwaukee Police Officer Kevin Camps.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion for dismissal of count 7 is heard and denied by the Court.  The Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Discovery received by defense counsel.  Case adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 1-29-2015 at 8:30 am.   mld

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION INCLUDING ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription AND no dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with SHEILA M. CHRISTINA A. AND CASEY I.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Eric Dewayne Lee in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Eric Dewayne Lee in custody.  Ryan T. Sanson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  AS TO COUNTS 5 & 7:  Motion to dismiss FOR LACK OF PROBABLE CAUSE by defense argued and DENIED by the Court.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant plead not guilty TO ALL MISDEMEANOR COUNTS.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge FLANAGAN, Branch 4.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
